page.title: 07TRANSPORT
page.content: Cars are considered to be a vital form of transport in the block. There is no bus service of any kind and people who do not own a car have to rely heavily on neighbours, friends or relations to take them to shops, Doctors, or any other appointments they may have. Children have to be transported to School by their parents which involves a round trip of 10 miles approximately. Cars are of course vital to the few inhabitants of the area who travel to work outside the district, without transport their employment prospects would be nil, except in the very few circumstances where their employers would make the arrangements to have them picked up each day.
